G4668-d-12-18-99-WC.Narrative: THE CREW FROM TRAIN T013 WAS SHOVING LIGHT ENGINE INTO THE TIE-UP TRACK #608 WITH THE CONDUCTOR RIDING THE PONT.  THE CONDUCTOR HAD COUNTED DOWN, 3-2-1 AND THEN GAVE "THAT WILL DO".  THE ENGINEER DIDNOT HEAR THE COUNT AFTER "2" AND CONTINUED TO SHOVE INSTEAD OF STOPPING IN HALF THE DISTANCE OF THELAST CONTACT (PER GCOR 5.3.7), OR ONE CAR LENGTH.  THE LIGHT ENGINES IMPACTED WITH TWO UNOCCUPIED ENGINES STANDING ON THE TRACK CAUSING DAMAGE TO ONE OF THE STANDING ENGINES AND ONE OF THE ENGINES THAT THE CREW HAD A HOLD OF.  NOTHING WAS DERAILED IN THE INCIDENT.  CREW MEMBERS WERE TESTED AND ALLRESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
